pull.title: rpc: Fix implicit-integer-sign-change in verifychain
pull.body:
It doesn't really make sense to treat `DEFAULT_CHECKLEVEL` as unsigned as long as `VerifyDB` accepts a signed integer.

Making it signed also avoids a cast round trip from signed->unsigned->signed in the RPC.

rpc: Fix implicit-integer-sign-change in verifychain

events.body:
# Test plan (with ubsan)

## Fuzz

```
echo 'dmVyaWZ5Y2hhaW5c//////9wc2J0/wAAAAAAfv/i4uL///////9/BQX/////Cg==' | base64 --decode > /tmp/crash
UBSAN_OPTIONS="suppressions=$(pwd)/test/sanitizer_suppressions/ubsan:print_stacktrace=1:halt_on_error=1:report_error_type=1" FUZZ=rpc ./src/test/fuzz/fuzz /tmp/crash
```

```

SUMMARY: UndefinedBehaviorSanitizer: implicit-integer-sign-change rpc/blockchain.cpp:1420:77 in 
```

## bitcoind/bitcoin-qt

`verifychain -1 1`

I can't reproduce the problem using `fuzz`. I'm using Ubuntu 21.10 and clang 14.0.0, in case that matters. The only unusual thing in my configuration is that it's build without optimization (built using `-O0`).
You'll need to enable ubsan. What is the configure summary?

Is there a way to just print the config? Here's how I did the build:
```
./autogen.sh && ./configure CXXFLAGS='-O0 -g' CC=clang-14 CXX=clang++-14 --enable-fuzz --with-sanitizers=address,fuzzer,undefined && make
```
I can also reproduce with `-O0`. Please share the exact steps to reproduce

> I can't reproduce the problem using `fuzz`. I'm using Ubuntu 21.10 and clang 14.0.0, in case that matters. The only unusual thing in my configuration is that it's build without optimization (built using `-O0`).

install for more command to the ubuntu 2110 and get more note for that ubuntu type

> Please share the exact steps to reproduce

Some things about my environment:
```
$ cat /etc/os-release # (I'll abbreviate the output of just this command slightly)
PRETTY_NAME="Ubuntu 21.10"
NAME="Ubuntu"
VERSION_ID="21.10"
VERSION="21.10 (Impish Indri)"
VERSION_CODENAME=impish
ID=ubuntu
ID_LIKE=debian
$ uname -a
Linux larry-VirtualBox 5.13.0-28-generic #31-Ubuntu SMP Thu Jan 13 17:41:06 UTC 2022 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ clang++-14 --version
Ubuntu clang version 14.0.0-++20220216033948+c561bf0daa95-1~exp1~20220216153959.57
Target: x86_64-pc-linux-gnu
Thread model: posix
InstalledDir: /usr/bin
$ 
```
Build, this time without `-O0`, starting in a fresh clone of `master`:
```
$ git checkout MarcoFalke/2202-rpcInt 
$ git checkout HEAD~ # back up one commit so that we don't have the fix
Previous HEAD position was fa8dad0e0 rpc: Fix implicit-integer-sign-change in verifychain
HEAD is now at 7164e00e1 Merge bitcoin/bitcoin#24324: test: refactor: remove unneeded bytes<->hex conversions in `byte_to_base58`
$ ./autogen.sh && ./configure CC=clang-14 CXX=clang++-14 --enable-fuzz --with-sanitizers=address,fuzzer,undefined --without-miniupnpc --disable-wallet --without-gui && make -C src test/fuzz/fuzz
$
```
Run the test
```
$ echo 'dmVyaWZ5Y2hhaW5c//////9wc2J0/wAAAAAAfv/i4uL///////9/BQX/////Cg==' | base64 --decode > /tmp/crash
$ UBSAN_OPTIONS="suppressions=$(pwd)/test/sanitizer_suppressions/ubsan:print_stacktrace=1:halt_on_error=1:report_error_type=1" FUZZ=rpc ./src/test/fuzz/fuzz /tmp/crash
INFO: Running with entropic power schedule (0xFF, 100).
INFO: Seed: 302550202
INFO: Loaded 1 modules   (229102 inline 8-bit counters): 229102 [0x5621d0f1b2a0, 0x5621d0f5318e), 
INFO: Loaded 1 PC tables (229102 PCs): 229102 [0x5621d0f53190,0x5621d12d2070), 
./src/test/fuzz/fuzz: Running 1 inputs 1 time(s) each.
Running: /tmp/crash
Executed /tmp/crash in 1 ms
***
*** NOTE: fuzzing was not performed, you have only
***       executed the target code on a fixed set of inputs.
***
$ 
```
I can reproduce, but this looks like an upstream bug, unrelated to the changes here, so let's continue discussion in #24394.
Oh, can you try again with `integer` sanitizer? `--with-sanitizers=integer,fuzzer,undefined`

Code-review ACK fa8dad0e078c577d740a9667636733957586c035

Related problem: could also change the `check_level` parameter of `VerifyLoadedChainstate` from `unsigned int` to `int`, in order to avoid another cast roundtrip from signed->unsigned->signed in the init procedure (`AppInitMain`), either in this PR or a follow-up. The same probably also for the `check_blocks` parameter (didn't check this one in detail though).
